entry.title: UMPQUA, SMITH, NORTH FORK SMITH RIVERS FISHERY IS NOW CLOSED
entry.summary: August 19, 2025 4:10 a.m. Fishing for Chinook salmon, both hatchery and wild, has closed on the Umpqua, Smith and North Fork Smith rivers because the quota of 500 wild fall Chinook has been reached. An update from the Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife said with forecasted low returns of wild fall Chinook salmon...

entry.title: SCHOLFIELD FIRE MOP UP CONTINUES
entry.summary: August 19, 2025 4:00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: On Monday, the Schofield Fire, burning near Reedsport, saw firefighters continuing aggressive mop up and grinding the fires perimeter for heat. An update from the Coos Forest Protective Association said firefighters continued to utilize wet ground conditions to aid this process. The fires perimeter showed no...

entry.title: HOYLE CONDEMNS PRESIDENT’S PUSH TO ELIMINATE MAIL-IN VOTING
entry.summary: August 19, 2025 3:50 a.m. In response to President Trump’s recent promise to eliminate mail-in voting, U.S. Representative Val Hoyle issued a statement: Hoyle said, “Oregon was the first state to enact full vote by mail, an effort led by both Democratic and Republican Secretaries of State. In Oregon, we’ve proven for nearly 30 years...

entry.title: UCC BEGINS CONSTRUCTION ON WELCOME CENTER/MEDICAL CAREERS HUB
entry.summary: August 19, 2025 3:40 a.m. Last week, Umpqua Community College officially launched construction of its new Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub, with the demolition of the Del Blanchard Administration Building and a celebration ceremony. A UCC release said the $21.5 million project will serve as both a new front door to campus and a...

entry.title: OPERATION HOME FRONT – BACK TO SCHOOL PRODUCTS FOR STUDENTS OF MILITARY
entry.summary: August 10, 2025 3:05 a.m. Operation Home Front has been collecting back to school items for students of active military and veterans. Products will be available on Wednesday and Thursday for those who have military identification, so they can come and shop for their children. entry.title: UCC ART GALLERY PRESENTS “TURNING THE/INTO TOOLS
entry.summary: August 19, 2025 2:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: The Art Gallery at Umpqua Community College presents a series of assemblage art pieces by Ralf Huber about the atrocities of child labor, past and present, in “Turning the/into Tools”. The show will be on display at the Whipple Fine Arts Center at UCC from...

entry.title: UCC Begins Work on Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub
entry.summary: Umpqua Community College has begun building a $21.5 million Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub. Opening in early 2027, it will centralize student services and expand medical training, backed by an $8 million state match and support from local partners.

entry.title: UCC's $21.5M project aims to transform Douglas County healthcare
entry.summary: ROSEBURG, Ore. - Umpqua Community College (UCC) has begun construction on a new Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub, which was kicked off on Friday with the demolition of the Del Blanchard Administration Building.

entry.summary: DRAIN — Ame Beard said she spent months planning the mermaid party with a group of people in Drain, after she was approached with the idea at another themed party she had thrown.

entry.title: ROSEBURG RECEIVES MOST MEASURABLE RAINFALL SINCE MAY
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 6:30 a.m. Roseburg received the most measurable rainfall on a day since May, on Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Roseburg Regional Airport measured 0.13 inches of rain. That was the biggest amount of rain since May 12th, when...

entry.title: SUPPRESSION EFFORTS CONTINUE ON HISTORIC DOERNER TREE FIRE
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 4:10 a.m. Firefighters from the Coos Forest Protective Association are actively engaged in suppression efforts on the Doerner Fir Tree fire. The historic tree, located east of Coquille on Bureau of Land Management land, was displaying active flames on the top and burning down a portion of the trunk. Multiple engines and...

entry.title: SCHOLFIELD FIRE REMAINS AT 50 ACRES NOW 43 PERCENT CONTAINED

An update from the Coos Forest Protective Association said the fire, located southeast of Reedsport, received measurable rain on Saturday. entry.title: SPECIAL TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT PATROLS THROUGH SEPTEMBER

entry.title: Roseburg burglar suspect entered home, cooked and ate food prior to arrest
entry.summary: A 33-year-old Roseburg man was arrested Thursday after allegedly entering a local residence where he spent several hours and cooked food for himself before he was eventually arrested, according to the Roseburg Police Department.
